newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RBA says financial conditions not impede growth.
newsitem.headline: RBA says financial conditions not impede growth.

text.p: Reserve Bank of Australia (RBA) Governor Ian Macfarlane said on Thursday financial conditions were not hindering economic growth.
"Financial conditions are not impeding the expansion of the economy at present," Macfarlane told a parliamentary hearing.
Official cash rates are currently around six percent.

The Reserve Bank said in its semi-annual monetary policy statement, released earlier on Thursday, that its current monetary policy stance was helping economic growth, which was showing signs of picking up.
The RBA said also that inflation was likely to remain low in the near-term but that recent wages data suggested that wages growth was becoming uncomfortably high.
